nodes.bodyText: Is there any chance this can be called multiple times by multiple threads for a given instance? If so, we should probably have the method be synchronized so we don't run the (minute?) risk of two simultaneous calls getting around the lock. If not, disregard this comment.
I will move to synchronized from lock to init; that seems better overall. Another quirk copied from ResourceLocatorMap.
Why are these all final? Is there a lambda I'm overlooking or some such?
This was just copy-paste from ResourceLocatorMap. Will remove, because it's really not providing value there.
I imagine the synchronized keyword is going to move up to init and then this will become private. Is there any situation where we want this to be locked externally?
Nope, I'll push an update shortly.
